newsitem.title: USA: Valassis Q3 net up from higher prices.
newsitem.headline: Valassis Q3 net up from higher prices.

text.p: Higher prices in its core insert business, increasing market share and lower paper costs helped Valassis Communications Inc post third quarter earnings Wednesday of $10.8 million, or $0.25 a share.
A year ago the company, which provides sales promotion services, earned $3.3 million or $0.08 a share.

The company said third quarter sales of its free-standing insert business jumped 8.7 percent to $120.1 million, while total market share of that business climbed to 50.9 percent from 46.8 percent at the end of the year-ago period.

"During the quarter, we greatly improved both FSI pricing and market share, and negotiated significantly lower paper prices," David Brandon, president and chief executive officer, said in a statement.

Brandon said the company is on track to reach its objective of publishing 1,325 to 1,400 national equivalent FSI pages for the year. He said customer contracts already in place for 1997 put the company in a position to reach that FSI volume next year.
